title: Love Commandments Quiz - Biblical Commands About Love
description: Test your knowledge of the 12 biblical commandments related to love. Covers 3 positive and 9 negative commandments from the Torah.

questions.question: Which commandment instructs to 'love your neighbor as yourself' and forbids taking vengeance or bearing a grudge?
options: Do not hate fellow covenant members
questions.explanation: Commandment #13 is positive and states in Leviticus 19:18 to love your neighbor as yourself and forbids taking vengeance or bearing a grudge.

questions.question: Which of the following commandments is a positive mitzvah?
options: Do not insult or harm a foreigner with words
questions.explanation: Commandment #16 is a positive commandment found in Leviticus 19:17, encouraging reproving a neighbor who sins.

questions.question: According to the commandments, why should one show love towards foreigners?
options: Because you were aliens in Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: Because you were aliens in Egypt
questions.explanation: Commandment #14 in Deuteronomy 10:19 commands showing love towards foreigners because the Israelites themselves were once aliens in Egypt.

questions.question: Which commandment explicitly forbids hating a fellow countryman in your heart?
options: Do not hate fellow covenant members
questions.correctAnswer: Do not hate fellow covenant members
questions.explanation: Commandment #15 forbids hating a fellow countryman in your heart as stated in Leviticus 19:17.

questions.question: Which negative commandment prohibits going about as a slanderer among your people?
options: Do not insult or harm a foreigner with words
questions.explanation: Commandment #19 forbids gossiping or acting as a slanderer among your people according to Leviticus 19:16.

questions.question: Which commandment requires not to stand idly by if someone's life is in danger?
options: Do not stand idly by if someone's life is in danger
Do not insult or harm a foreigner with words
questions.correctAnswer: Do not stand idly by if someone's life is in danger
questions.explanation: Commandment #489 is negative and forbids standing idly by if someone's life is in danger, as found in Leviticus 19:16.

questions.question: Which book contains the most commandments in the 'Love' category listed here?
questions.explanation: Leviticus contains the majority of these commandments in the 'Love' category, including #13, #15, #16, #17, #19, #20, #21, and #489.

questions.question: Which of these commandments directly relates to monetary fairness towards foreigners?
options: Do not cheat a foreigner monetarily
Do not insult or harm a foreigner with words
questions.correctAnswer: Do not cheat a foreigner monetarily
questions.explanation: Commandment #502 forbids cheating a foreigner monetarily as stated in Exodus 22:21.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids both taking revenge and bearing a grudge?
options: Do not stand idly by if someone's life is in danger
Do not hate fellow covenant members
questions.explanation: Commandment #13 forbids taking revenge and bearing a grudge while commanding love for neighbors, found in Leviticus 19:18.

questions.question: True or False: The commandment to 'reprove a neighbor who sins' is a negative commandment.
questions.explanation: Commandment #16 is a positive commandment instructing to reprove a neighbor who sins, as stated in Leviticus 19:17.

questions.question: True or False: Commandments to love others and foreigners are only found in the book of Leviticus.
questions.explanation: While many love commandments are in Leviticus, commandment #14 (show love towards foreigners) is found in Deuteronomy 10:19.

questions.question: True or False: Commandment #17 forbids embarrassing others as part of the prohibition against hating a fellow countryman.
questions.explanation: Commandment #17 forbids embarrassing others, linked with not hating a fellow countryman, in Leviticus 19:17.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The commandment 'You shall not wrong a stranger or oppress him' is found in the book of ___.
questions.explanation: Commandments #18, #502, and #503 all contain 'Do not wrong or oppress a stranger' found in Exodus 22:21.

questions.question: Which commandment emphasizes the practical action required when a neighbor sins?
questions.explanation: Commandment #16 requires actively reproving a neighbor who sins, demonstrating love through correction (Leviticus 19:17).

questions.question: Which negative commandment focuses on forbidding verbal harm specifically towards foreigners?
options: Do not insult or harm a foreigner with words
Do not cheat a foreigner monetarily
questions.correctAnswer: Do not insult or harm a foreigner with words
questions.explanation: Commandment #503 forbids insulting or verbally harming foreigners as stated in Exodus 22:21.
